==Chinese==

===Etymology 1===
{{zh-forms|alt=仟-financial}}

====Glyph origin====
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|一|人|c1=s|c2=p|ls=psc|t1=one, signifying a number}}. The Old Chinese pronunciations of {{och-l|千}} and {{och-l|人}} were similar. For the component {{zh-l|*人}}, compare its combining form {{zh-l|*亻}}.

The traditional explanation holds that the extra line indicates an [[extension]] (see the etymologies of {{zh-l|*年}} and {{zh-l|*延}}). {{lang|zh|千}} has the meaning ''[[one thousand]]'' because ''one thousand'' is a number that is reached by extending one's counting.
